Player History
Drafted in 4th round, 73rd overall pick, by New York (A) in 1966...
Injured on 7/8/1966 with a Sore Back, out for one week...
Released by New York (A) on 4/15/1969...
Drafted in 2nd round, 26th overall pick, by Chicago (A) in 1973...
Injured on 7/9/1976 with a Inflamed Hip Muscle, out for 5 days...
Had first career hit on 6/16/1977, off Ken Brett (BAL)...
Hit first career homerun on 6/25/1977, off Ron Guidry (MIN)...
Injured on 5/6/1980 with a Strained Posterior Cruciate Ligament, out for 6-7 weeks...
Signed as a free agent by California on 2/1/1983 to a 3-year deal worth $1,356,547 per year...
Drove in 6 runs against Minnesota on 6/29/1984...
